New Records: The Dodgers became the first team to come back from five or more runs down in a World Series-clinching win.
Key Match Events: The Yankees appeared bound to send a series they’d once trailed 3-0 back to Los Angeles for a sixth game when Aaron Judge and Jazz Chisholm Jr pounced on Dodgers starter Jack Flaherty with back-to-back homers in the first inning.
The Dodgers piled on five unearned runs to go level in the fifth behind a series of dreadful errors from the Yankees and RBI hits from Mookie Betts, Freddie Freeman and Teoscar Hernández.
The Yankees nosed ahead 6-5 on a Stanton sacrifice fly in the sixth, but the Dodgers took the lead for good in the eighth on a pair of sacrifice flies by Gavin Lux and Mookie Betts.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers and Yankees were meeting in the World Series for a 12th time, making it the most frequent matchup in the history of the Fall Classic.

Shohei Ohtani, the Dodgers’ record $700m signing, finished his first World Series with a.105 batting average (2-for-19) with no RBIs after separating his shoulder during a stolen base attempt in Game 2.
Others: The eight pitchers used by the Dodgers was a World Series record for a clinching win.

Walker Buehler, making his first relief appearance in more than six years, struck out the final batter to secure the win. He became only the second pitcher in World Series history to earn a win as a starter and record the save in the clinching victory after Madison Bumgarner.
